headline: How The Narrative Around Meta Platforms (META) Is Shifting With AI Spending And Valuation Concerns
summary: The latest update on Meta Platforms trims the fair value estimate slightly from US$837.15 to US$835.54, as the revenue growth outlook is nudged from 16.67% to 16.73% and the discount rate shifts from 8.30% to 8.33%. This small recalibration reflects a balance between confidence in AI driven growth, backed by recent positive ad trends and product traction, and fresh caution around heavier AI related spending and what that could mean for the long term risk profile. headline: Vistra Wins Mega Nuclear Deal With Meta, Stock Jumps
summary: Vistra Corp. (NYSE:VST) stock rose Friday after the company disclosed a 20-year power purchase agreement (PPAs) with Meta Platforms, Inc. (NASDAQ:META). Details The deal involves supplying over 2,600 MW of zero-carbon power from three nuclear plants to support Meta's regional operations. In particular, Meta will purchase 2,176 MW of nuclear energy from Vistra's operating Perry and Davis-Besse plants in Ohio, along with an additional 433 MW of capacity from uprates at Perry, Davis-Besse, and Beav

headline: Sam Altman Weighs An $830B–$1T IPO And Admits Running A Public Company Could Be 'Really Annoying'
summary: A potential mega IPO is coming into focus, but enthusiasm for life as a public-company CEO appears limited. "Am I excited to be a public company CEO? 0%," OpenAI CEO Sam Altman said on the "Big Technology Podcast." "Am I excited for OpenAI to be a public company? In some ways, I am, and in some ways I think it'd be really annoying." He told host Alex Kantrowitz that while public markets can play a role in value creation, leading a public company comes with trade-offs he does not find appealing.

headline: Netflix Stock Has A January Superpower — And The Numbers Prove It
summary: Netflix Inc. (NASDAQ:NFLX) has developed a striking seasonal pattern that traders have come to recognize: January has historically been its strongest month of the year, and by a wide margin. Over the past two decades, Netflix shares have posted an average January gain of 14.7%, finishing the month higher in 71% of years. That performance meaningfully outpaces both the broader S&P 500 and most large-cap technology peers over the same period, cementing January as a recurring sweet spot for the str

headline: Review & Preview: Lackluster Jobs, Lively Market
summary: Wall Street cheered a lower unemployment rate, even though the December jobs figure missed expectations.  The Nasdaq Composite rallied 0.8%.  At 4.4%, the unemployment rate still came in below the expected 4.5%, and November’s figure was revised lower to 4.5%.

headline: Investor Michael Burry Reveals Options Bet Against Oracle
summary: Burry owns put options on Oracle shares, he said in a Substack post after markets closed on Friday.  Burry, who revealed bearish bets against AI chipmaker Nvidia Corp. and Palantir Technologies Inc. in November, also directly shorted Oracle during the last six months, he said.
